intro: Tristania suaveolens var. riparia, commonly known as the river tristania, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its aromatic, fragrant leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows along riverbanks and moist habitats, adapting to wet environments. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar morphological features. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens in suitable climates.
